recount3 0.99.9

Compute read counts

Source: R/transform_counts.R
compute_read_counts.Rd

As described in the recount workflow, the counts provided by the recount2 project are base-pair counts. You can scale them using transform_counts() or compute the read counts using the area under coverage information (AUC).

compute_read_counts(
  rse,
  round = TRUE,
  avg_mapped_read_length = "recount_qc.star.average_mapped_length"
)

Arguments

rse

A RangedSummarizedExperiment-class created by create_rse().
round

A logical(1) specifying whether to round the transformed counts or not.
avg_mapped_read_length

A character(1) specifying the metdata column name that contains the average fragment length after aligning. This is typically twice the average read length for paired-end reads.

Value

A matrix() with the read counts. By default this function uses the average read length to the QC annotation.

Details

This function is similar to recount::read_counts(use_paired_end = TRUE, round = TRUE) but more general and with a different name to avoid NAMESPACE conflicts. Note that the default value of round is different than in recount::read_counts(). This was done to match the default value of round in transform_counts().

References

Collado-Torres L, Nellore A and Jaffe AE. recount workflow: Accessing over 70,000 human RNA-seq samples with Bioconductor version 1; referees: 1 approved, 2 approved with reservations. F1000Research 2017, 6:1558 doi: 10.12688/f1000research.12223.1.

See also

Other count transformation functions: compute_scale_factors(), is_paired_end(), transform_counts()

Examples


## Create a RSE object at the gene level
rse_gene_SRP009615 <- create_rse_manual("SRP009615")

#> 2020-10-16 23:35:04 downloading and reading the metadata.
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:05 caching file sra.sra.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/metadata/15/SRP009615/sra.sra.SRP009615.MD.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:05 caching file sra.recount_project.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/metadata/15/SRP009615/sra.recount_project.SRP009615.MD.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:05 caching file sra.recount_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/metadata/15/SRP009615/sra.recount_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:06 caching file sra.recount_seq_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/metadata/15/SRP009615/sra.recount_seq_qc.SRP009615.MD.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:06 caching file sra.recount_pred.SRP009615.MD.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/metadata/15/SRP009615/sra.recount_pred.SRP009615.MD.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:07 downloading and reading the feature information.
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:07 caching file human.gene_sums.G026.gtf.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/annotations/gene_sums/human.gene_sums.G026.gtf.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:08 downloading and reading the counts: 12 samples across 63856 features.
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:08 caching file sra.gene_sums.SRP009615.G026.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/gene_sums/15/SRP009615/sra.gene_sums.SRP009615.G026.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:09 construcing the RangedSummarizedExperiment (rse) object.
colSums(compute_read_counts(rse_gene_SRP009615)) / 1e6

#> SRR387777 SRR387778 SRR387779 SRR387780 SRR389079 SRR389080 SRR389081 SRR389082 
#>  21.33424  23.70639  32.67551  25.50398  41.55222  28.10329  17.81035  15.49213

#>  18.88160  18.21900  13.90269  15.17254 

## Create a RSE object at the gene level
rse_gene_DRP000499 <- create_rse_manual("DRP000499")

#> 2020-10-16 23:35:09 downloading and reading the metadata.
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:09 caching file sra.sra.DRP000499.MD.gz.

#> 2020-10-16 23:35:12 downloading and reading the counts: 21 samples across 63856 features.
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:17 caching file sra.gene_sums.DRP000499.G026.gz.
#> adding rname 'http://idies.jhu.edu/recount3/data/human/data_sources/sra/gene_sums/99/DRP000499/sra.gene_sums.DRP000499.G026.gz'
#> 2020-10-16 23:35:18 construcing the RangedSummarizedExperiment (rse) object.
colSums(compute_read_counts(rse_gene_DRP000499)) / 1e6

#> DRR001622 DRR001623 DRR001624 DRR001625 DRR001626 DRR001627 DRR001628 DRR001629 
#> 10.972020  8.007966 11.893009       NaN  7.530776 11.289832 53.523929 27.598855 
#> DRR001630 DRR001631 DRR001632 DRR001633 DRR001634 DRR001635 DRR001636 DRR001637 
#> 27.775202 35.363611 48.757827 20.621330 35.136076 31.677099 34.907348 46.346187 
#> DRR001638 DRR001639 DRR001640 DRR001641 DRR001642 
#> 31.559936 27.044245 18.953532 17.820245 25.432056 

## You can compare the read counts against those from recount::read_counts()
## from the recount2 project which used a different RNA-seq aligner
## If needed, install recount, the R/Bioconductor package for recount2:
# BiocManager::install("recount")
recount2_readsums <- colSums(assay(recount::read_counts(
    recount::rse_gene_SRP009615
), "counts")) / 1e6

#> Setting options('download.file.method.GEOquery'='auto')
#> Setting options('GEOquery.inmemory.gpl'=FALSE)
#> No methods found in package ‘IRanges’ for request: ‘values<-’ when loading ‘derfinder’
#> No methods found in package ‘IRanges’ for request: ‘values’ when loading ‘derfinder’
recount3_readsums <- colSums(compute_read_counts(rse_gene_SRP009615)) / 1e6
recount_readsums <- data.frame(
    recount2 = recount2_readsums[order(names(recount2_readsums))],
    recount3 = recount3_readsums[order(names(recount3_readsums))]
)
plot(recount2 ~ recount3, data = recount_readsums)

abline(a = 0, b = 1, col = "purple", lwd = 2, lty = 2)


## Repeat for DRP000499, a paired-end study
recount::download_study("DRP000499", outdir = tempdir())

#> 2020-10-16 23:35:24 downloading file rse_gene.Rdata to /tmp/RtmpqhS9Ga
load(file.path(tempdir(), "rse_gene.Rdata"), verbose = TRUE)

#> Loading objects:
#>   rse_gene

recount2_readsums <- colSums(assay(recount::read_counts(
    rse_gene
), "counts")) / 1e6
recount3_readsums <- colSums(compute_read_counts(rse_gene_DRP000499)) / 1e6
recount_readsums <- data.frame(
    recount2 = recount2_readsums[order(names(recount2_readsums))],
    recount3 = recount3_readsums[order(names(recount3_readsums))]
)
plot(recount2 ~ recount3, data = recount_readsums)

abline(a = 0, b = 1, col = "purple", lwd = 2, lty = 2)
